title: Highest Water Productivity
description: In 2021, Monaco achieved a water productivity of 1500.05 constant 2015 US$ GDP per cubic meter of freshwater withdrawal, the highest globally.

title: 100% Marine Protected Areas
description: By 2024, Monaco had designated 100% of its territorial waters as marine protected areas, showcasing its commitment to marine conservation.

title: Near Total Protected Areas Coverage
description: In 2024, 99.5% of Monaco's total territorial area was under protection, highlighting its dedication to environmental preservation.

title: Top Government Effectiveness
description: In 2023, Monaco ranked at the top percentile for government effectiveness, indicating a highly efficient and effective governance system.

title: High Fixed Telephone Subscriptions
description: In 2023, Monaco had 111 fixed telephone subscriptions per 100 people, reflecting a well-established telecommunication infrastructure.

title: Highest GDP per Capita
description: In 2023, Monaco's GDP per capita was $256,580.52, the highest in the world, indicating a very high standard of living.

title: Exceptional Primary Education Completion
description: In 2016, Monaco achieved a primary completion rate of 150.18% for the relevant age group, indicating a highly successful education system.

title: High Secondary School Enrollment
description: In 2016, Monaco's secondary school enrollment rate was 154.16%, showcasing a strong emphasis on education.

title: Universal Urban Sanitation Services
description: By 2022, 100% of Monaco's urban population had access to safely managed sanitation services, reflecting excellent public health infrastructure.

title: High Life Expectancy
description: In 2023, Monaco's life expectancy at birth was 86.37 years, one of the highest globally, indicating a high quality of life and healthcare.

title: Aging Population Challenge
description: In 2023, 36.36% of Monaco's population was aged 65 and above, indicating a significant aging population challenge.

title: High Age Dependency Ratio
description: In 2023, Monaco had an age dependency ratio of 72.04%, suggesting a high burden on the working-age population to support the elderly.

title: High Crude Death Rate
description: In 2023, Monaco's crude death rate was 20.97 per 1,000 people, indicating potential public health challenges.

title: Minimal Rural Land Area
description: In 2015, Monaco had a rural land area of just 0.03495 square kilometers, making it one of the smallest in the world.

title: High Urban Land Vulnerability
description: In 2015, 0.5579 square kilometers of Monaco's urban land was below 5 meters in elevation, indicating vulnerability to rising sea levels.

title: Tiny Total Land Area
description: Monaco's total land area was recorded at 2.084 square kilometers in 2022, highlighting its status as one of the smallest countries globally.

title: Minimal Capture Fisheries Production
description: In 2022, Monaco's capture fisheries production was just 1 metric ton, reflecting its limited fishing activities.

title: Low Nonperforming Loan Ratio
description: In 2019, Monaco's banks had a nonperforming loan ratio of 0.24%, indicating a healthy banking sector.

title: Limited Air Transport Activity
description: Monaco registered only 3 air transport departures in 2019, showcasing its limited air travel infrastructure.

title: Low Passenger Air Traffic
description: In 2019, Monaco carried 316 air transport passengers, reflecting its small-scale air travel operations.

title: Significant Education Expenditure
description: In 2023, 45.39% of Monaco's total secondary education expenditure was dedicated to current expenses, indicating a strong focus on education.

title: Minimal Infant Mortality
description: Monaco recorded only 1 infant death in 2023, showcasing its excellent healthcare system.

title: Low Under-Five Mortality
description: In 2023, Monaco had just 1 under-five death, reflecting its high standard of child healthcare.

title: Minimal Neonatal Mortality
description: Monaco reported only 1 neonatal death in 2023, underscoring its advanced neonatal care facilities.

title: Low Adult Male Mortality Rate
description: In 2023, Monaco's adult male mortality rate was 31.22 per 1,000, indicating a high life expectancy for males.

title: Balanced Female Working Age Population
description: In 2023, 49.93% of Monaco's female population was aged 15-64, reflecting a balanced working-age demographic.

title: Small Female Age Group 30-34
description: In 2023, 4.33% of Monaco's female population was aged 30-34, indicating a smaller proportion in this age group.
